More Notes: Reduced by increases in wet days and extreme daily rainfall, in addition to responding nonlinearly to the total annual and to the standardized monthly deviations of rainfall.
High-income nations and the service and manufacturing sectors are most strongly hindered by both measures of daily rainfall
Complements previous work that emphasized the beneficial effects of additional total annual rainfall
Rainfall effect depends on total rainfall
Effect of a 1-s.d. shock in annual total rainfall. Sample mean: 0.77
Effect of a 1-s.d. negative shock in monthly rainfall deviations. Sample mean: -1.01
Effect of a 1-s.d. shock in number of wet days. Sample mean: -1.34
Effect of a 1-s.d. shock in extreme daily rainfall. Sample mean: -0.43
Marginal effect of total annual rainfall on sectoral growth (agriculture, manufacturing, services). Values vary by sector/rainfall amount. A placeholder of 0 is used.
Effect of monthly rainfall deviations on sectoral growth (agriculture, manufacturing, services). Values vary by sector/deviation amount. A placeholder of 0 is used.
Marginal effect of number of wet days on sectoral growth (agriculture, manufacturing, services). Values vary by sector/wet days. A placeholder of 0 is used.
Effect of extreme daily rainfall (represented by annual mean temperature) on sectoral growth (agriculture, manufacturing, services). Values vary by sector/temperature. A placeholder of 0 is used.
